Amiodarone – cardioversion to sinus rhythm
Two RCTs reported the use of amiodarone.14,26 Delle Karth and colleagues14 reported a non-significant difference favouring amiodarone bolus followed by infusion compared with amiodarone bolus alone (OR=1.22; 95% CI, 0.32–4.31; P=0.75) or diltiazem (OR=1.91; 95% CI, 0.52–7.00; P=0.33) at cardioversion to sinus rhythm. Conversely, Moran and colleagues26 reported that amiodarone was not as effective as magnesium at achieving cardioversion of NOAF to sinus rhythm (OR=0.53; 95% CI, 0.11–2.59; P=0.44).14 Neither study reported data on mortality or LoS.
